alert.note: Alert for Allen; Barren; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 2:47PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Monroe, central Allen and southern Barren Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 147 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Scottsville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Monroe, central Allen and southern Barren Counties, including the following locations... Eighty Eight, Oak Forest, Gum Tree, West Fork, Maynard, Haywood, Austin, Nobob, Settle and Yesse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
